basics.name: Philip Matunda
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: Currently building for the web, mostly with Laravel and Vue, Co-organizer Vuejs Kenya, Mentor at Exercism and GDSC Kabarak University.

work.summary: Worked on Kenya Health Information system products used by MoH used Nationally and within Nakuru and Baringo Counties.
highlights: Participated in the EID/VL(Early Infant Diagnosis/Viral Load) system hackathon where I took part in the development of a Client Based registry.
Contributed to the refactoring & upgrade of the CPIMS(Child Protection Information Management System) used by the Department of Children Services.
Deployment and performing system upgrades of the extended KenyaEMR used in four facilities in Nakuru and the Baringo County Referral hospital in Baringo.
Lead student engagement at Kabarak University in development and customization of Kenya Health Information Systems

volunteer.summary: I'm taking part in the development of CPIMS APIs endpoints
I'm taking part in speakers engagement, planning and execution of events, meetups and community partnership within Kenya & Sub-sahara Africa tech communities
Pioneered GDSC Kabarak University through building technical capacity in the university around Google technologies(Firebase, Android, GCP, Flutter). Currently mentoring the community
Exercism is an online, open-souce, free coding platform that offers code practice and mentorship.
highlights: I learn best by teaching developers at Exercism, Javascript language
